data.title: Brooks Darnell To Y&R As The New Dr. Nate Hastings
data.meta_description: Casting news out of The Young and the Restless. Soap Opera Digest is reporting that former Shadowhunters star, Brooks Darnell has been cast on the CBS Daytime soap opera as Dr. Nate Hastings. On Shadowhunters, Darnell played the role of Charlie Cooper, now in Genoa City he takes on the role of Olivia Barber’s (Tonya […]
data.text:
By

Casting news out of The Young and the Restless.

Soap Opera Digest is reporting that former Shadowhunters star, Brooks Darnell has been cast on the CBS Daytime soap opera as Dr. Nate Hastings.

On Shadowhunters, Darnell played the role of Charlie Cooper, now in Genoa City he takes on the role of Olivia Barber’s (Tonya Lee Williams) son, who will be revealed to be secretly treating Victor Newman (Eric Braeden).

As viewers know, Victor has been acting mysterious and avoiding answering his family’s questions when they inquire about the status of his health post-coma, which is post-falling down a flight of stairs after rumble with J.T. (Thad Luckinbill).

The character of Nate was last played in 2011 by Walter Fauntleroy.

So, what do you think is wrong with Victor? Glad to hear Nate Hastings will be back on the canvas? Comment below.

Breaking News

Phil Donahue, Legendary Daytime Talk Show Host, Dies at 88

By

Phil Donahue, a trailblazer in the daytime talk show format, has passed away. The longtime TV talk show host died on Sunday night, August 18th after a long illness his family shared. He was 88-years old.

Marlo Thomas, Donahue’s wife for more than 44 years, along with his sister, children, grandchildren and his beloved golden retriever, Charlies surrounded him as he passed on. The news of his death was confirmed by Today on Monday.

It was just three months ago in May, that Donahue received the Presidential Medal of Freedom from President Joe Biden.

Phil’s success truly began when the issue-oriented The Phil Donahue Show was picked up for national syndication in 1969, then was renamed Donahue in 1974. Soon, more than 200 stations carried his show. The talk show continued on until 1996, when the daytime talkshow landscape changed to the Jerry Springer and Sally Jesse Raphael’s of it all. In addition, Oprah Winfrey and her success was taking away his female audience.

During his run, segments of Donahue were also broadcast three times a week on NBC’s Today, and he joined the staff as a regular interviewer. He also hosted NBC primetime specials, including the Emmy-winning Donahue and Kids and the five-part Phil Donahue Examines the Human Animal.

Later in 2002-03, Donahue briefly returned to television with a self-titled MSNBC talk show in which he interviewed newsmakers on social and political issues.

In his career, Phil would win 10 Daytime Emmys for Outstanding Host and 10 for Outstanding Talk Show, and the show would capture 200 Emmys during its run.

When Donahue called it quits at the age of 60, Oprah Winfrey presented him with a Daytime Emmy Lifetime Achievement honor in 1996, and shared, “I want to thank you for opening the door so wide, wide enough for me to walk through. Had there not been a Phil Donahue, I don’t believe there could have been an Oprah.”

After receiving his Lifetime Achievement Daytime Emmy, Phil, in turn, shared, “Having to go in there every day and jump out of a cake and make sure you have a nice crisp clean shirt and all that, it was wonderful while it lasted, but I think we chose the right time to walk. I’ve never regretted it.”

The family requested that donations be made to St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital or the Phil Donahue/Notre Dame Scholarship Fund in lieu of flowers.

Survivors include Donahue’s second wife, Marlo Thomas, whom he married in 1980; and his five children from his first marriage.

Share your remembrances and condolences on the passing of Phil Donahue via the comment section below.

Breaking News

John Aprea, ‘Another World’ and ‘Knots Landing’ Actor, Dead at 83

By

John Aprea, best-known to soap fans for his role as Lucas (Luke) Castigliano on Another World, has died at the age of 83.

His manager confirmed his death, which happened earlier this month on August 7th according to TMZ, and August 5th according to the Hollywood Reporter. The motion picture and television actor passed away of natural causes at his home in Los Angeles surrounded by loved ones.

Another World fans will recall that Aprea played two roles on the soap: Luke from 1989 to 1993, and Alexander Nikos from May 1997 to January 1998. Lucas was one of the loves of Felicia Gallant’s (Linda Dano) life, and they shared a daughter that was put up for adoption, Lorna Devon played by Alicia Coppola.

More recently, and in an ironic twist, Aprea appeared on the streaming series The Bay in seasons 6 and 7, which like Another World, is set in a town called “Bay City.” On The Bay, John played the role of the town’s former mayor, Jack Madison.

The Bay’s showrunner, Gregori J, Martin shared, “It was such a great honor to have the privilege of working with an icon like John on The Bay. I have always been a fan of his work and he was a true gentleman and absolute pro who brought some beautiful moments to the role of Jack in these later seasons. We will all miss him dearly.”

Knots Landing fans will remember Aprea from his turn as bad guy Manny Vasquez. John’s former Knots Landing co-star Paul Carafotes (ex-Harold Dyer) took to his Instagram on learning the news of John’s passing, sharing, “I just heard that my old pal, friend. Actor, father, husband, brother. We had lots of laughs. We met on the set of CBS television show Knots Landing, 1987. Over 40 years ago. Many will miss this man! Rest old friend. I’ll see you on the other side.”

Aprea is also known for his work in The Godfather Part II where he played a young Salvatore Tessio in the 1974 film, and on the 80s TV sitcom Full House and its reboot 3o years later, Fuller House in the role of Nick Katsopolis, father of Jesse played by GH alum, John Stamos (ex-Blackie Parrish).

Throughout his career, Aprea appeared in several television shows including: Falcon Crest, The Rookies, The F.B.I., Wonder Woman, Silk Stalkings, The Sopranos, Cold Case, NYPD Blue and CSI to name a few.

John is survived by his third wife, Betsy, daughter, Nicole, from a previous marriage to actress Ninon Aprea; and stepchildren Marika and Valentino.

Share your remembrances and condolences for John Aprea via the comment section below. But first, check out this segment from the ‘Another World’ reunion hosted by Linda Dano where she reminisces with John and Alicia Coppola.

Breaking News

Eugene and Dan Levy Named Hosts of 76th Primetime Emmy Awards on ABC

By

The father and son duo of Eugene Levy and Dan Levy are locked in, and it has been made official, that they will be hosting the 76th Primetime Emmy Awards on September 15th on ABC.

This marks the first time they have hosted the annual kudofest. Eugene and Dan previously became the first father and son duo to win Emmys in the same year. It was back in 2020, during the pandemic Emmy broadcast, both took home the gold for their work in Schitt’s Creek and it was the same year that they broke the record for most wins by a comedy series with nine.

In a joint statement on their upcoming gig, the Levys shared, “For two Canadians who won our Emmys in a literal quarantine tent, the idea of being asked to host this year in an actual theater was incentive enough. We’re thrilled to be able to raise a glass to this extraordinary season of television and can’t wait to spend the evening with you all on Sept. 15.”

Eugene Levy also finds himself nominated for two Emmy Awards for his series The Relunctant Traveler which streams on Apple TV+. Levy is nominated for Outstanding Hosted Nonfiction Series Or Special and for Outstanding Writing For A Nonfiction Program – for the episode,”Scotland: My Mother’s Country,”

Craig Erwich, president, Disney Television Group, said of the choice of the Levy’s to host the broadcast, “Eugene’s and Dan’s comedic intuition and uncanny ability to capture the hearts of viewers will make for a memorable Emmys telecast honoring this year’s best and brightest.”

The Primetime Emmys also revealed their production team in full with Jesse Collins Entertainment’s Jesse Collins, Dionne Harmon and Jeannae Rouzan-Clay back as executive producers, and Eric Cook joining them as a co-executive producer.

The rest of the team who are back from last year include: Alex Rudzinski as director, Brittany Brazil as co-executive producer, Taryn Hurd as producer, Brian Stonestreet as production designer, Jon Macks as head writer, Noah Mitz as lighting designer and Drew Findley as screens producer and Rickey Minor as the music director.

The 76th Emmy Awards will air live coast to coast from the Peacock Theater at L.A. Live in Los Angeles on ABC and stream next day on Hulu.

So, what do you think of the pick of Eugene and Dan Levy as the hosts of the 76th Primetime Emmy Awards? Comment below.
